frameDefinitions: A Host provides a temporary Residence for a Lodger.
In this frame, which is a  part of the Trial sequence, a Judge gives a Finding with respect to the Charges against the Defendant in a particular Case.
A person (the Cognizer) comes to believe something (the Content), sometimes after a process of reasoning.
A Cognizer makes a judgment about an Evaluee.
An Inspector attains a degree of certainty in the Unconfirmed_content, generally by inspecting some evidence.
Two (or more) people (the Parties, also encodable as Party_1 and Party_2) negotiate an agreement.
frameExamples: We <t>housed</t> her in our home for a while.
He was <t>convicted</t> of fraud by Judge Judy.
Based on the most recent census I have <t>concluded</t> that most Americans sleep too much.
JUDGMENT:  She <t>admired</t> Einstein for his character.
So far , we have <t>agreed</t>to cede 100km of coastline to Kiribati . DNI
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Host</fen> is the individual (or group of individuals) that own or control the <fen>Residence</fen> and allow the  <fen>Lodger</fen> to temporarily stay there.
The <fen>Lodger</fen> is the individual who is given permission to lodge in the <fen>Residence</fen>.
The location controlled by the <fen>Host</fen> which the <fen>Lodger</fen> stays at temporarily.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the <fen>Host</fen> provides a Residence to the <fen>Lodger</fen>
The <fen>Place</fen> is where the <fen>Host</fen> provides a temporary <fen>Residence</fen>.
The <fen>Judge</fen> (which may be the jury, judge, magistrate or court) decides on the <fen>Finding</fen>.
This role identifies the outcome of the <fen>Judge</fen>'s deliberation or consideration. Many LUs in this frame incorporate this FE.
The person who stands accused of a crime and is subject to the verdict.
This role refers to the <fen>Charges</fen> with respect to which the verdict is being given.
The <fen>Case</fen> on which the verdict is being given.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
Cognizer is the person who comes to believe something.
Words in this frame may occur with a PP headed by <ment>from</ment> which expresses the Evidence on which knowledge or belief is based:
With a target verb, the Content is usually expressed as a finite clausal Complement or an Object NP, and may sometimes be expressed by a PP:

Some verbs in this frame may occur with postverbal Topic expressions: They <t>found out</t> <fex name='Topic'>about us</fex>! More generally verbs in this frame may occur with quantificational nouns followed by Topic expressions:
An act performed by the <fen>Cognizer</fen> which enables them to figure something out.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the text created by the <fen>Cognizer</fen> to communicate that they came to believe a specified <fen>Content</fen>.
The time at which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> discovers the <fen>Content</fen>.
The location at which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> realizes the <fen>Content</fen>.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> makes the judgment. This role is typically expressed as the External Argument (or in a <ment>by</ment>-PP in passives).
Evaluee is the person or thing about whom/which a judgment is made. With verbs this role is typically expressed as Object:
Typically, there is a constituent expressing the <t>Reason</t> for the Judge's judgment. It is usually a <ment>for</ment>-PP, e.g.
<fen>Expressor</fen> is the body part or action by a body part that conveys the judgment made by the <fen>Cognizer</fen>.
The individual or individuals that ascertain that the <fen>Unconfirmed_content</fen> is true.
An open proposition that the <fen>Inspector</fen> decides by examining evidence.  It is usually a propostion put forward which some parties would disbelieve or contest.
The <fen>Medium</fen> is the piece of text or work in which the <fen>Inspector</fen> verifies the <fen>Unconfirmed_content</fen>:
This role describes the <fen>Time</fen> at which the verification event takes place.
This role describes where the verificiation event takes place.

The individual or individuals that form the more prominent (i.e.
agentive) party of the agreement, as compared with <fen>Party_2</fen>. That is,
<fen>Party_1</fen> is generally encoded as the External Argument of verbs, and
peripheral FEs that do not make reference to the event itself
generally make reference to <fen>Party_1</fen>. Thus <fen>Manner</fen> is construed to be that of <fen>Party_1</fen>, not necessarily that of <fen>Party_2</fen> or the group of <fen>Parties</fen> as a whole.

The semantically (and grammatically) less prominent participant (or
group of participants) in the agreement. It is generally encoded
within a prepositional phrase (e.g. headed by with).
An expression of the commitment made by the <fen>Parties</fen> .
<fen>Topic</fen> is a description of the domain covered.
The group of individuals portrayed as equally involved in making an agreement.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> where the Agreement occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the Agreement occurs.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Sue</fex> realized that Bob was lost.
I have learned <fex>from experience</fex> that poison oak can be painful.
The President learned <fex>that the reporters were hungry</fex>.
The jury learned something terrible <fex>about the suspect</fex>.
<fex>A post-mortem examination</fex> was unable to ascertain the cause of death.
<fex>Back at the tailor's shop</fex>, I deduced that our murderer was not the owner of the kerchief.
<fex>The boss</fex> appreciates you for your diligence.
The boss appreciates <fex>you</fex> for your diligence.
I admire you <fex>for your intellect</fex>.
She viewed him with an appreciative <fex>gaze</fex>.
<fex>His</fex> later verification of the facts is certainly beyond reproach.
It is extremely difficult to confirm <fex>the absence of something</fex>.
<fex>Chapter four</fex> confirms the reader 's suspicions completely.
On Monday, <fex>the airline</fex> reached a deal with the Canadian Auto Workers.
Mozilla Foundation has finally reached an agreement <fex>with America Online</fex>.
The US and Russia have agreed <fex>to share early warning data on missile launches</fex>.
Some types of alloy steel have been covered in the expiring <fex>trade</fex> agreement.
<fex>The US and Russia</fex> have agreed to cooperate in destroying surplus portable anti-aircraft missiles.
The town coucil members finally reached an agreement <fex>at midnight</fex>.
The town coucil members reached an agreement <fex>at the City Hall plenary session</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: The Institute for the Advancement of Aboriginal Women
Chapter Four of Just Another Indian
the Institute for the Advancement of Aboriginal Women
Just Another Indian: A Serial Killer and Canada's Indifference
